title: The Southern Climate Impacts Planning Program expands the Simple Planning Tool to Texas
content:
Simple Planning Tool screenshot. Credit: NOAA, SCIPP
Simple Planning Tool screenshot. Credit: NOAA, SCIPP
The Southern Climate Impacts Planning Program (SCIPP), a NOAA RISA team, is pleased to announce the expansion of the Simple Planning Tool to Texas. The tool, previously available in Oklahoma and Arkansas, assists planners, emergency managers, and decision makers in Texas who are assessing their long-term climate risks, both historically and in the future. The tool was primarily designed for decision makers who serve small- to medium-sized communities but may also be of interest to those who serve larger areas. The Simple Planning Tool for Texas Climate Hazards is a compilation of relatively easy-to-use online interactive tools, maps, and graphs relevant to 17 hazards: 14 climate hazards and 3 non-climate hazards.
